page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
In the 18th Century Stagecoach travellers thought it was the coldest bleakest place between London and York. The Swan hotel was built so that they could stop the night.In 1935 it was the first building in the area to have electric light.It is called the Swan because the swan is the emblem of the Isham family and it belonged to them until Sir Gyles Isham gave it to his valet as a reward for being a good servant.
RELIGION All Hallows Church-Built in the 17thC by Sir Justinian Isham to replace an old one which had fallen down. It has a lot of memorials to the Isham Family. There is a service every Sunday.
